The opening titles tell us we're at the end of time, but how much time do they mean? What time do they think humanity is at? People are still printing books, practising religion, getting furious about old politics, and writing out flimsy paper scrolls and censorship forms. I purchased this movie at a car boot sale, so I was not expecting it to be a horror movie on the same level as A Nightmare on Elm Street. It is not, by any stretch of the imagination. It’s not even a horror film, really. It just falls between, and so is not really Chicago’s best, but it’s worth a look. It came in at number seventeen on Cahiers du Cinéma’s list of the top 100 films

I find it heart-warming and inspiring that the writing team behind such hopelessly mainstream Hollywood movies like INDIANA JONES AND THE TEMPLE OF DOOM (1984) & INDIANA JONES AND THE KINGDOM OF THE CRYSTAL SKULL (2008) produced three sequels to ROBOCOP (1987). Along with the superior T2 (1991), the psychotic robotic kill-machines movies are icons of the eighthies.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to Disney’s original fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to my point of view is a pretty cover of an original. The new music, “Let me breathe” is average, too.
The worst thing found is the casting. My favorite actress, Angela Bassett

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
